channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Traffic light timing issue, 23rd October
item.description:
The lights on the roundabout have a timing issue. The light goes green but the road is obstructed by vehicles from other junctions so there is no ear route of travel. By time it clears the other lights go green.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Green light stopped working recently., 23rd October
item.description:
It's the first right hand light facing you just after you pass Jasmin way on your left and just before the turning into Brizen Centre on the right.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Up Hatherley Way, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Street lights turning off at bizarre times, 22nd October
item.description:
My neighbour has reported this last week, these two lights switch off at random times, it’s incredibly dark especially when leaving for work at the early hours. Is there a reason why they aren’t being looked at or fixed?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Baltimore Court, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is very badly placed signage at this junction on a pretty blind bend. There will be a crash unless it’s moved., 22nd October
item.description:
Whittington bus stop on the A40
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Cotswold

item.title: Grass verge, 22nd October
item.description:
Grass verge has encroached over foot path , Mobility scooter users find it very frightening with speeding cars ,hgvs ,and buses ,added to this the Traffic counter tube cover is quite high ,(could cause Mobility scooter to tip into the road ).Also the new Estate entrance has dimple drop kerbs but a you can See from the images they are not keep clear. The mobility scooter rider travels this route twice a day.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing Bin, 22nd October
item.description:
This bin on the entrance to Springfield park is overflowing. Residents have reported this to the council but it seems to have been missed more than once.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Grenadier Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham

item.title: Trench sinking leaving massive potholes, 22nd October
item.description:
With GE on your left heading north just before the roundabout - see location I’ve pinpointed on map. Trench is sinking leaving huge potholes right as I start to turn the wheel on my car. I’ve hit it twice now, possibly throwing my tracking out as well as damage to my suspension/goodness knows what other further potential damage!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles problem, 22nd October
item.description:
Temps lights was rearranged on saturday and customer is wanting some more information on them and has mentioned that there is really no need for them to be there any more. No permit is on confirm either.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.title: Potholes on carriageway, 22nd October
item.description:
There are at least 4 potholes in the road outside our property which are damaging the tyres and suspension of our vehicles as they pass over it in order to gain access to our property. The main carriageway was recently repaired prior to surface dressing but these holes and repair to the strip beyond our gate were not marked. The strip of land beyond our boundary (between our gate and the carriageway) is legally owned and should be maintained by highways. This strip is crumbling/granulating with private and commercial vehicles turning in it or using it as a passing place. Our solicitor confirmed ownership rests with highways prior to our property purchase in 2019 and it is classed a ‘ransom strip’ to which she confirmed we have legal access to our property over. Highways are legally therefore required to maintain it l, including repair of potholes, and to the granulated surface. Location: Silver Leys, Brockhampton, GL54 5TH What3Words: ///surveyors.engine.trouser

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Charlton Abbots Road, Sudeley, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road closed due to pothole repairs, 22nd October
item.description:
Work is currently being undertaken without proper signage (No 'Road Ahead Closed'). The live data on my tomtom isn't showing the closure, neither is it on one.network! I have just driven over a mile down the road to be confronted with a 'Road Closed' sign! Current time is 14.20
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hartley Lane, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
